bibl.title: Letter from N. P. Macphail to P. F. Murphy, December 21, 1923

div1.p: Macphail gives Murphy some history on the man who died of malaria shortly after leaving a ship in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from N. P. Macphail to P. F. Murphy, December 21, 1923
div1.opener:
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
Medical Department
QUIRIGUA HOSPITAL - MEDICAL DEPARTMENT
321 St. Charles Street
New Orleans, La
Quirigua, Guatemala
December 21st, 1923
Dr. P. F. Murphy
Port Medical Officer
United Fruit Company
Dear Doctor:-
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of December 18th referring to
James E. Roudabush and asking for such information about him as I could glean
locally.

I found that our Port Agency have records to the effect that
“Joseph E. Roudabush” left the S/S “SURINAME” in Barrios on August 26th, and
was around Barrios for some time, and was known there as a “drunken Beachcomber”.
As far as I can find out he was not seen by a Doctor, but demanded to be shipped
back to the States. Our Port superintendent states that the man claimed to have
Venereal disease, but as to whether that was so or not he is unable to say.

He was shipped by the American Consul as a “Consular Passenger” on
the S/S “SARAMACCA” about September 16th.

As far as I can find out there was no medical diagnosis made on him
while in Barrios but he might have seen one of the native doctors on his own
account.

He was not seen by any of the Quirigua Doctors nor did he receive
medical attention here.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, (Signed) N. P. Macphail
Medical Superintendent.
